newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka stocks end ranged on back of blue chips.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka stocks end ranged on back of blue chips.

text.p: Sri Lanka stocks closed flat on Wednesday on local buying of selected stocks, brokers said.
The all share index closed 0.34 points up at 634.80. Gainers out-numbered decliners by 26 to 12. John Keells Holdings Ltd rose 3.75 rupees to 201.75, while Hayleys Ltd fell five to 205.
"The rise in John Keells was cancelled off by the fall in Hayleys," said Subram Ramasamy, deputy general manager of brokerage Bartleet Mallory.
Trading was dominated by local retail investors as big institutions were not available, he said.

Turnover was 25.17 million rupees on 875,318 shares, led by local buying of 100,000 Asiri Hospitals Ltd, 104,800 Colombo Dockyard Ltd, 70,000 Kotagala Plantations Ltd and 139,000 Mercantile Leasing Ltd.
Buyers are holding out for lower prices in the run-up to March 21 local government polls, while sellers believe they can get premiums after the election, brokers said.
